page.title: 17The Playing Field: FINTRY
page.content:
The{Ruth Menzies Memorial Playing Field. A bequest to the village.
A few years after its inauguration in 1978, it was extended by the gift of the remaining part of the field. The facility is now quite magnificient for the size of population it serves.
In addition to providing space for boys to informally 'kick a ball', the field is used for organised sport. Currently it is the home ground of { {Strathendrick Rugby Club,}enabling good class rugby to be played and seen in the village. There is also a lively football section, the game being played, parents helping, at{Primary & {Under 16 levels.}This season (1985) it is proposed to launch a senior team. There is also a section of the field devoted to{horse riding and jumping.
